page.title: 13 Lord Hertford's Estate cont
page.content: The Marquis owns 6000 acres of land altogether.Only 3000 acres of which consists of the Hall grounds and surrounding farms,which the Marquis and his workers keep.On this land wheat, barley,oats,grass and hay for silage is grown.400 Fresian cows (240 dairy),13 horses and a large number of sheep.The rest of the 6000 acres is made up of 1000 acres of woodland and 2000 acres of,separately run farms.Altogether there are 47 workers running the 6000 acres- 3 gardeners,11 main farm workers 4 in the woods,2 maintenance,1 lodge keepers,assistant gate-keeper and the are farm labourers who help run the 86 farms on the estate. There are also several staff inside Ragley Hall-a cook,a butler,8 daily cleaners,5 guides,1 running the sweet shop and up to 8 running the tea room.
